video.title: TEDTalks: Artistry and Illusion
video.synopsis: Astounding artists, photographers and illusionists enchant the audience with these TEDTalks that boggle the mind and stir the heart.

episodes.synopsis: Using three iPods like magical props, Marco Tempest spins a clever, surprisingly heartfelt meditation on truth and lies, art and emotion.
episodes.title: Marco Tempest: The Magic of Truth and Lies (and iPods)

episodes.synopsis: Magician David Blaine describes what it took to hold his breath underwater for 17 minutes -- a world record -- and what his work means to him.
episodes.title: David Blaine: How I Held My Breath for 17 Minutes

episodes.synopsis: How do you stage an art show with work from 100 artists? If you're Shea Hembrey, you invent all of the artists and artwork yourself. Watch how.
episodes.title: Shea Hembrey: How I Became 100 Artists

episodes.synopsis: Artist Béatrice Coron cuts intricate worlds with scissors and paper and explains how her stories develop from snips and slices.
episodes.title: Béatrice Coron: Stories Cut from Paper

episodes.synopsis: Nick Veasey shows outsized X-ray images that are dangerous and painstaking to produce, from the geometry of a flower to the anatomy of a Boeing 747.
episodes.title: Nick Veasey: Exposing the Invisible

episodes.synopsis: Robert Lang is a pioneer of the newest kind of origami -- using mathematical principles to fold intricate designs that are sometimes very useful.
episodes.title: Robert Lang Folds Way-New Origami

episodes.synopsis: Beau Lotto's color games puzzle your vision but also spotlight your own versatile sense of sight and how evolution tints your perception of reality.
episodes.title: Beau Lotto: Optical Illusions Show How We See

episodes.synopsis: Swedish doctor Lennart Green says,"Pick a card, any card." But what he does with the cards is stunning, lightning-fast, how-does-he-do-it? magic.
episodes.title: Lennart Green Does Close-up Card Magic

episodes.synopsis: Watch how artist Nathalie Miebach takes data from massive storms and turns it into complex sculptures that become music for a string quartet to play.
episodes.title: Nathalie Miebach: Art Made of Storms

episodes.synopsis: Alison Jackson explores our desire to get personal with celebs by making photos that show them doing what we secretly want to see them doing.
episodes.title: Alison Jackson Looks at Celebrity

episodes.synopsis: Artist and engineer Golan Levin use modern tools to make surprising art. Watch as sounds become shapes and a curious eye looks back at the viewer.
episodes.title: Golan Levin Makes Art That Looks Back at You

episodes.synopsis: Combining dry wit with artistic depth, poet Billy Collins shares a project in which several of his works were turned into delightful animated films.
episodes.title: Billy Collins: Everyday Moments, Caught in Time

episodes.synopsis: Quixotic Fusion -- an ensemble of artists that brings together aerial acrobatics, dance, theater, film, music and visual effects -- performs.
episodes.title: Quixotic Fusion: Dancing with Light

episodes.synopsis: Marco Tempest spins a story of what magic is, how it entertains us and how it highlights our humanity -- all while working extraordinary illusions.
episodes.title: Marco Tempest: A Magical Tale (with Augmented Reality)

episodes.synopsis: Wayne McGregor demonstrates how a choreographer communicates ideas to an audience, working live with two dancers to build phrases of dance.
episodes.title: Wayne McGregor: A Choreographer's Creative Process in Real Time

episodes.synopsis: Kinetic sculptor Reuben Margolin crafts beautiful pieces that move in patterns inspired in equal parts by math and nature.
episodes.title: Reuben Margolin: Sculpting Waves in Wood and Time

episodes.synopsis: Marco Tempest straps on augmented reality goggles and does a card trick like you've never seen before, weaving a lyrical tale as he deals.
episodes.title: Marco Tempest: A Cyber-magic Card Trick Like No Other
